citations.narrative:
The facility acquisition and disposition records did not accurately reflect the animals observed on inspection. A single
enclosure contained 7 Scrub Jays but only 1 was recorded on the acquisition records. The other 6 birds within the same
enclosure were part of their wildlife rehabilitation program and waiting for release. Complete and accurate records are
needed to ensure each animal can be known with certainty and facilitate the ability to trace all animals. The licensee shall
make, keep and maintain records or forms which correctly disclose the required information concerning animals other
than dogs or cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, or which is transported, sold, euthanized or otherwise disposed of by
the exhibitor, including any offspring born.
Correct by: 8/14/2025

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The screech owl/kestrel enclosure, red tail hawk/swainson’s hawk enclosure, and scrub jay enclosure were observed to
have a buildup of wet excrement, food waste, and spider webs covering the walls and floors. Insufficient cleaning can lead
to disease hazards, insects, pest and odors. Excreta and food waste must be removed from within, under, and around the
primary enclosure often enough to prevent excessive accumulation.
Correct by: 8/14/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility acquisition and disposition records did not accurately reflect the animals observed on inspection. A single 
enclosure contained 7 Scrub Jays but only 1 was recorded on the acquisition records. The other 6 birds within the same 
enclosure were part of their wildlife rehabilitation program and waiting for release. Complete and accurate records are 
needed to ensure each animal can be known with certainty and facilitate the ability to trace all animals. The licensee shall 
make, keep and maintain records or forms which correctly disclose the required information concerning animals other 
than dogs or cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, or which is transported, sold, euthanized or otherwise disposed of by 
the exhibitor, including any offspring born. 
Correct by: 8/14/2025 
3.158(a)(1) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The screech owl/kestrel enclosure, red tail hawk/swainson’s hawk enclosure, and scrub jay enclosure were observed to 
have a buildup of wet excrement, food waste, and spider webs covering the walls and floors. Insufficient cleaning can lead 
to disease hazards, insects, pest and odors. Excreta and food waste must be removed from within, under, and around the 
primary enclosure often enough to prevent excessive accumulation. 
Correct by: 8/14/2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
